constituent: jubilation, deer, cave, antlers, crown, heart, walking legs
heisigStory: Deer . . . crown (note the doubling up) . . . heart . . . walking legs. You may recall that we met the relative primitives at the bottom here before, in the kanji for melancholy (Frame 663).
koohiiStory1: The hunter experienced jubilation when the deer with melancholy walked up to him and said, "just shoot me, whats the point in running. Everyone dies someday..."
koohiiStory2: Bambi was melancholy at the death of his mother, but is now in jubilation as he´s made friends with thumper.
words: joy, delight, rapture, pleasure, gratification, rejoicing, congratulations, felicitations
